conclusion: The area under a velocity-time graph represents the displacement of the object.
Object A has a larger area under its curve compared to object B from 0 to t1.
Displacement of object A from 0 to t1 is the area under curve A.
Displacement of object B from 0 to t1 is the area under curve B.
At any time t within the interval 0 to t1, the displacement of A is greater than that of B.
The difference in displacement between A and B at any time t is given by the difference in the areas under the curves from 0 to t.
Since the area under curve A is always increasing faster than the area under curve B, the difference in displacement is continuously increasing.
The difference in displacement between the two objects is continuously increasing from 0 to t1.
